intro: Monadenium trinerve, commonly known as the three-veined monadenium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Amaranthaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its succulent stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny, greenish flowers that are often clustered in dense inflorescences. Monadenium trinerve is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and is adapted to thrive in hot, dry environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies of drought-tolerant flora.
